senses.sense_definition: The quality or state of possessing color or coloration.

examples.text: The intense <w>chromatism</w> of the autumn leaves created a spectacular view in the valley.
Biologists studied the <w>chromatism</w> of the insect's wings to understand its camouflage mechanisms.

senses.sense_definition: A defect in an optical system where light is dispersed into different colors, preventing a sharp focus.

examples.text: The photographer noticed significant <w>chromatism</w> around the edges of the subject in the image.
High-quality telescope lenses are designed to correct optical <w>chromatism</w> for a clearer picture.

senses.sense_definition: A condition in which hearing a sound evokes the visualization of a color.

examples.text: Her <w>chromatism</w> allowed her to see flashes of blue whenever the piano was played.
The artist claimed his paintings were inspired by the <w>chromatism</w> he experienced while listening to jazz.
